qas.question: What are the risks of wrestling?

answers.text: high chance of injury, and even death

qas.question: What is the ring commonly made of?
What are common injuries in wrestling?

answers.text: shoulders, knee, back, neck, and rib injuries

qas.question: What other injuries have been connected with wrestling?

answers.text: Chronic traumatic encephalopathy and traumatic brain injuries

qas.question: Chris Benoit was involved in what tragic event?

context: Although professional wrestling is worked, there is a <a0_0>high chance of injury, and even death<a0_0/>. Strikes are often stiff, especially in Japan and in independent wrestling promotions such as Combat Zone Wrestling (CZW) and Ring of Honor (ROH). The ring is often made out of <a1_0>2 by 8 timber planks<a1_0/>. Many of the injuries that occur in pro wrestling are <a2_0>shoulders, knee, back, neck, and rib injuries<a2_0/>. <a3_0>Chronic traumatic encephalopathy and traumatic brain injuries<a3_0/> have also been linked to pro wrestling, including in the <a4_0>double-murder suicide case<a4_0/> involving Chris Benoit. Professional wrestler Davey Richards said in 2015, "We train to take damage, we know we are going to take damage and we accept that".
